results.title: The Three faces of Eve
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Nunnally Johnson
results.brief_description: Joanne Woodward, in a performance which earned her the Oscar for Best Actress, plays Eve White, a mousy withdrawn housewife with multiple personalities. After startling her husband by behaving completely out of character, and having blackouts, Eve visits a psychiatrist, played by Lee J. Cobb. From these sessions, emerges the personality of Eve Black, a sexy, uninhibited woman who expresses those parts of Eve White’s personality which she has suppressed. Eventually, her third self emerges as Jane; an intelligent, sensible woman, who helps resolve and integrate the different facets of Eve’s personality into a whole and healthy human being. Based on a true story, this acclaimed drama explores the dimensions of the human mind.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Nunnally Johnson

results.title: The Three blind mice
results.brief_description: This animated film illustrates why industrial safety rules must be observed. The nursery rhyme favorites prove no less foolish in the factory than when they provoked reprisal from the farmer’s wife. They disobey all the safety rules with dire results.
results.description: This animated film illustrates why industrial safety rules must be observed. The nursery rhyme favorites prove no less foolish in the factory than when they provoked reprisal from the farmer’s wife. They disobey all the safety rules with dire results.

results.title: The Three A's
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Great Britain. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: One of the principles introduced into education in Great Britain as a result of the New Education Act of 1944 is that of stressing the three A’s rather than the traditional three R’s; the three A’s are - age, ability, and aptitude, of each individual pupil. By considering these three A’s, teachers and parents are better able to provide for each child the type of education most suited to their needs. The aim of education becomes the co-ordination of classroom and practical experience, so that children learn to apply their knowledge and skills to the demands of everyday life.

results.title: The Thread makers
results.creator_credit: James Archibald and Associates, James Archibald and John Chittock
results.brief_description: Illustrates the nature of J. & B. Coats’ activities as makers and marketeers of thread of all types for every variety of use. Filmed in India, Austria, Spain, England and Scotland with a strong emphasis on the human interest. The development of synthetic thread, requiring new techniques and processes, is shown to be a likely prospect for the future

results.title: The Thomson River Dam
results.creator_credit: Cine Service Productions, Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works and Geoffrey Thompson
results.brief_description: The dam that was built on the Thomson River in the Great Dividing Range almost doubled the capacity of Melbourne’s water storage as well as aiding in flood control. This is a record of its progress, including the environmental study and the relationship of the dam to downstream users. Suitable for secondary school level.
